title: Ticket #5224: JobRouter Hook crashes condor_job_router
description:
I'm testing a JobRouter translate hook with HTCondor-CE and everytime my jobs invoke the hook the CE's condor_job_router process crashes.

Hook config in /etc/condo-ce/config.d/99-local.conf 

PILOT_HOOK_TRANSLATE_JOB = /usr/libexec/htcondor-job-router/pilot-translate.py

My submit script (attached) contains this line: 

+HookKeyword = "PILOT"

The error in JobRouterLog: 

07/24/15 17:58:27 JobRouter (src=80283.0,route=Local_PBS): claimed job
07/24/15 17:58:27 Hook PILOT_HOOK_TRANSLATE_JOB: /usr/libexec/htcondor-job-router/pilot-translate.py
07/24/15 17:58:27 error opening watchdog pipe /var/lock/condor-ce/procd_pipe.watchdog: Permission denied (13)
07/24/15 17:58:27 ProcFamilyClient: error initializing LocalClient
07/24/15 17:58:27 ProcFamilyProxy: error initializing ProcFamilyClient
07/24/15 17:58:27 waiting a second to allow the ProcD to be restarted

The above errors repeat a few times then this is printed: 

07/24/15 17:58:32 ERROR "unable to restart the ProcD after several tries" at line 677 in file /builddir/build/BUILD/condor-8.2.8/src/condor_utils/proc_family_proxy.cpp

The file mentioned in log: 

prw------- 1 condor root 0 Jul 24 18:25 /var/lock/condor-ce/procd_pipe.watchdog

Original ticket: https://ticket.opensciencegrid.org/26291
remarks:
2015-Aug-18 15:38:13 by emfajard:
One more thing the problem seems to go away when: 
JOB_ROUTER.USE_PROCD=false

2015-Aug-25 22:28:43 by bbockelm:
Edgar -

Can you do a build of the posted branch as a scratch in Koji for Troy?

2015-Aug-31 16:15:06 by jfrey:
I've attached an alternative patch for this bug. The fix proposed previously duplicated an existing class (TemporaryPrivSentry). The new patch also adds missing calls to uninit_user_uids().

2015-Sep-01 08:28:59 by bbockelm:
Hi Jaime,

It wasn't really duplication - it was a specific change in semantics. The new class set the priv state to a given value on exit; the old class did the priv state change and reset it back on exit.

Can you modify your patch to use RAII? I'm uncomfortable manually enumerating all the exit paths.

Brian

2015-Sep-08 15:12:44 by jfrey:
Brian, what do you think of the priv_sentry.patch I just added to this ticket?

It allows the existing TemporaryPrivSentry object to be used without changing the priv state during construction, and enables uninitializing the user uids (opt-in).

2015-Sep-08 15:22:37 by bbockelm:
Much better! Looks good to me.
attachments:
